comment: Available outside of class frequently. Offers partial credit on exams. Pop quizzes occasionally but you get to work with a group. He wants students to do well. Lectures are important to attend. Office hours are helpful as well. If you do your work and try he will make sure you pass. I would recommend him to everyone!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Avoid taking his class if you can. Most of these reviews are true; he randomly gives pop quizzes. doesn't answer questions clearly, but when it comes to testing, he is a very harsh grader. Tests are not like homework at all. Constantly pushes office hours but is unhelpful during them. Very disorganized and takes a long time to grade tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Laws is alright. He was not a good professor at the beginning of the semester, but he listened to student feedback and improved which I can really respect. The tests are pretty hard and differ from the homework quite a bit. I would say the homework is a lot harder, which results in a lot of people not being able to finish it.

I had him twice, 1113 and 1190. He promised to do a quiz every week to 2 weeks. In 1113 he did, but in 1190 we only did 3 the entire semester. He moved a test for Ard because he had a meeting once, everyone failed the test because of it. He got aggravated when a DEAN came down to talk because everyone was near failing and we told the truth.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Okay, Professor Laws is NOT bad at all. I took his class because there were no other available professors. He genuinely likes what he teaches and is willing to help you out. Take advantage of his office hours. He cares about your success, just speak up and do work on time. He is a bit awkward, but a nice guy overall. Take him if no better options.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I would strongly recommend not to take this teacher. Im very surprised he even has 5 star reviews and find it add they use the same manners and grammar he uses in his emails. He is not an understanding teacher will respond to questions passive aggressively. Makes you feel like he does you favors for fixing his own mistakes on assignments and dates.

Homework is done in Aleks. Professor Laws is accessible outside of class via office hours and the Open Math lab. He is a very caring and down to earth man. He may seem a little awkward, but he's a really nice man, and is always willing to help his students, but you have to meet him halfway. He gives study guide that is very similar to the tests !!

he gives a packet that youll use the whole semester and its filled with notes. he works on problems during class and makes it easy to learn. attendance is not mandatory but he gives quizzes randomly (he drops 3 at the end of semester). hes really nice and easy to talk to. he grades test very fairly and gives bonus points. i liked him a lot!
this class is easy but the professor sucks. he doesnt answer emails ever and when asked for help he just ignored me.

Officially, Laws wasn't my Math1111 prof., but I would see him a lot in math lab (2-3 times/week). He is understanding, and more than happy to work through problems. Overall I absolutely love him as a prof. I learned more from him than my own College Algebra prof. He is such a sweetheart and is new to Kennesaw. He really values his students too.

Laws was a nice guy but I would not take him again for math (at least not online, I do not know how he is in person). I have never gotten a B in a math course before and math is usually a good subject area for me. His lectures are extremely slow paced and hard to keep track of and understand. If you can avoid him for online, do it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Laws was a great choice for Pre-Cal. All homework was done on ALEKS, and he goes over every topic due that week with multiple examples and shows easy ways to finish problems. Homework is due every week. Midterm is pie progress which just comes from doing homeworks. 4 tests, and the final will replace the lowest test grade. Always has office hours.

4 tests, one dropped for the final. Calculus I is a big jump from pre-calc, so if you didn't study in pre-calc and soared by, get ready to do work. He is a very fair grader if effort is put in, and the tests are reasonable. He applies some questions not gone over in class, but if you do the homework and get the concept, you will do great here.

DO NOT TAKE Worst math professor EVER. You use MML and the homework doesn't correspond with what you do in class. He straight up said " what's on the hw may not be how I want it on the test". Took 10 points off a test because I rounded to 3 places and not 4...... I took precal before this and got a 99% and then I STRUGGLED to get a B in here.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I took Math 1113 as a summer course and Mr. Laws was great. Class is long and he moves VERY slow but honestly it helps if you are not a math genius. His test are very much questions that you see in class. Show up, work hard and its an easy A+. He is very nice too!!
This sums up our class- we do a warm up then worksheets are handed out. He's not very helpful. I have spent money on a lot of tutoring and still cannot pass a test. Avoid his class at all costs.

Laws is a nice guy but SUCKS as a teacher. There is class everyday, he never cancels. He puts things on the test that you havent even learned. He gives you a study guide but when you ask for the answers, there are none so good luck with the tests! Half the time he doesnt even know what hes explaining in the lectures and causes confusion!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY
